recipe.title: Apple Cider, Onion, and Raisin Chutney
ingredients: two 10-ounce cartons of fresh pearl onions, blanched in boiling water for 3 minutes, drained, and peeled
1/4 cup firmly packed light brown sugar
instructions: In a large saucepan combine the cider, the vinegar, the onions, the raisins, the brown sugar, the cloves, and salt and pepper to taste and boil the mixture, stirring occasionally, for 30 to 35 minutes, or until the liquid is reduced to a syrupy consistency. The chutney keeps, covered and chilled, for 1 week. Serve the chutney with roasted meats or poultry.
